entry.title: SUNSHINE PUNCH
entry.content:
Sunshine Punch? Absolutely! This vibrant and refreshing drink is perfect for brightening up your summer. Whether you're lounging by the pool or just looking for a tasty way to hydrate, the SEEQ Sunshine Punch has got you covered for those hot Summer days ahead ü§ô

¬†

¬†

Cook Time: 5 minutes

Servings: 1

Ingredients:

  • 1/2 Scoop of SEEQ Fruit Punch
  • 6 oz of water
  • 2 oz orange juice (freshly squeezed for the best flavor)
  • 1 oz pineapple juice
  • 1/2 oz lemon juice
  • 1/2 oz lime juice
  • 1 tablespoon honey or agave syrup (adjust based on your sweetness preference)
  • 3 oz sparkling water
  • Ice cubes
  • Garnish: orange slice, cherry, or a sprig of mint

Instructions:

  1. Prepare the Juices: In a shaker, combine the orange juice, pineapple juice, lemon juice,¬†lime juice, SEEQ Fruit Punch protein, and water.
  2. Sweeten: Add honey or agave syrup to the juice mixture. Secure the lid on the shaker and shake vigorously until combined.
  3. Chill: Fill a glass halfway with ice cubes.
  4. Mix: Pour the mixed juices over the ice in the glass.
  5. Sparkle: Top off with sparkling water. Stir gently to combine everything.
  6. Garnish: Decorate with an orange slice, a cherry, or a mint sprig for that extra special touch.
  7. Serve: Enjoy your Sunshine Punch, savoring the burst of citrus and the refreshing fizz!

Perfect for a sunny day, this Sunshine Punch is a delightful way to enjoy your day with a burst of flavor and energy!

entry.title: WATERMELON MARGARITA
entry.content:
This margarita is perfect addition to you Cinco De Mayo celebration if you're looking for something refreshing, fun, and Non-Alcoholic.¬†Follow the instructions below to make yours today!

Cook Time: 5 Minutes

¬†

INGREDIENTS:

  • 16oz water
  • Lime juice
  • Salt for the glass rim
  • 1 scoop of SEEQ Watermelon
  • 2-5 Mint leaves (optional)
  • Ice
  • Optional: 2oz Tequila Blanco

INSTRUCTIONS:

  1. Start by combining lime juice, watermelon juice, 2 mint leaves, water, SEEQ protein in a blender or shaker.
  2. Shake the blender bottle gently to mix the ingredients together or use a blender to make a frozen marg!¬†
  3. After shaking or blending,¬†run one of the lime wedge around the rim of your choice of glass then dip into salt
  4. Add ice to your glass (if you're making a frozen marg skip this step)
  5. Pour the marg mixture into a glass¬†and ake your drink fancy by adding a wedge of lime. Throw in a few mint leaves on top of the drink.
  6. Enjoy your delicious Watermelon Marg ü•Ç¬†

entry.title: Daniel's Tropical Smoothie
entry.content:
Daniel was one of our first customers when we initially launched our company in October 2021. He later let us in on his SEEQret recipe in November, which makes this our first known recipe to date.

This tropical smoothie recipe is the perfect way to get your daily dose of high-quality protein, and it's made with juicy fruit flavors that are sure to excite your taste buds. With just a few simple ingredients and a blender, you can whip up this delicious and protein-packed smoothie in no time. Whether you're looking for a quick breakfast on-the-go, a post-workout snack, or a refreshing treat for a hot day, this smoothie is the perfect choice.

With this delicious and refreshing Tropical Smoothie recipe featuring Mango Pineapple SEEQ Clear Whey Protein, you can start your day or fuel up after a workout with a protein-packed, tasty drink. Try it out and let us know what you think!¬†

¬†

¬†

Cook Time: < 5 minutes

Servings: 1

INGREDIENTS:

  • 1 scoop of Mango Pineapple SEEQ Clear Whey Protein
  • 1 cup frozen mango
  • 1/2 cup Greek yogurt
  • 4 oz water

INSTRUCTIONS:

  1. Start by adding all the ingredients to a blender, including the Mango Pineapple SEEQ Clear Whey Protein, frozen mango, Greek yogurt, and water.
  2. Blend the mixture on high speed until it's smooth and creamy.
  3. If the mixture is too thick, you can add more water or a splash of milk to thin it out.
  4. Pour the Tropical Smoothie into a glass and enjoy immediately.

¬†

TIPS & TRICKS:

  • Want to get in your daily value of fruit and vitamin C? Add some frozen pineapple to your smoothie as well! Pineapple has 5x more vitamin C than oranges! Adding in frozen pineapple and mango is the simplest (and most delicious) way to enhance the flavor of our SEEQ protein powder and leave your taste buds begging for more.¬†¬†

entry.title: Electric Lemonade
entry.content:
When you think of summertime drinks, what comes to mind? For many of us, lemonade is at the top of the list. There's nothing quite like a cold, refreshing glass of lemonade on a hot summer day. But what if we told you that there's a new twist on this classic drink that can also help you meet your fitness goals? That's right ‚Äì we're talking about Electric Lemonade featuring Blue Razz SEEQ Protein Powder.

This protein-packed drink is the perfect way to fuel your workouts, build muscle, and stay hydrated all at once. Plus, it's incredibly easy to make! Simply mix together some lemonade, water, and a scoop of Blue Razz SEEQ Protein Powder, and you'll have a delicious and nutritious drink that's perfect for any time of day.

¬†

Cook Time: < 5 minutes

Servings: 1

INGREDIENTS:

  • 6 oz lemonade
  • 6 oz water
  • 1 scoop of Blue Razz SEEQ Protein Powder

INSTRUCTIONS:

  1. Start by adding 6 oz of water to a glass.
  2. Next, add 6 oz of lemonade to the glass.
  3. Then, add 1 scoop of Blue Razz SEEQ Protein Powder to the glass.
  4. Use a frother or a blender bottle to mix everything together until it's well combined.
  5. Let the foam settle.
  6. Add ice to the glass.
  7. Enjoy your delicious Electric Lemonade!

¬†

TIPS & TRICKS:

  • If you‚Äôre wanting to cut out some extra sugar, instead of a premade lemonade, make your own lemonade at home! Combine lemon juice, water, and your low-calorie sweetener of choice to make a tasty lemonade
  • Looking for a little extra protein in your life? Go ahead ‚Äî add that extra scoop of Blue Razz.¬†
  • Make your electric lemonade Instagram worthy by adding a garnish and share it with us on your favorite social media channel @seeqsupply¬†

entry.title: Juicy Protein Strawberry Lemonade w/ Strawberry Ice
entry.content:
Ingredients
- 1 scoop Strawberry Lemonade Clear Protein
- 16 oz. Water
- Fresh strawberries¬†
- Fresh lemons

Instructions:
1. Make it fancy: Chop fresh strawberries and add them to your ice tray with water. Freeze until solid for vibrant strawberry ice cubes.
2. In a shaker or large glass, mix 1 scoop of SEEQ Strawberry Lemonade with 16 oz. cold water. Stir or shake 3. until fully dissolved and juicy.
4. Fill a tall glass with strawberry ice and lemon slices.
5. Pour the SEEQ mix over the ice.

¬†

entry.title: Strawberry Lemonade Matcha
entry.content:
This juicy Strawberry Lemonade Matcha Refresher is your new daily ritual‚Äîwith a juicy twist.

It starts with SEEQ Strawberry Lemonade Clear Protein, a boost from earthy ceremonial matcha, and a finish strong over ice and lemon slices for that layered, eye-candy effect.

Whether you‚Äôre easing into a hot yoga flow or powering through your morning to-do list, this drink hits different. It‚Äôs clean. It‚Äôs green. It‚Äôs juicy.

Ingredients:
- 1 scoop SEEQ Strawberry Lemonade Clear Protein
- 16 oz. cold water
- 1.5 tsp ceremonial grade matcha
- 2 oz. hot water (for whisking matcha)
- 1 cup ice
- A few fresh lemon slices

¬†

Instructions:
1. Whisk your matcha with 2 oz. hot water until smooth and frothy. Set aside.
2. In a shaker or large glass, mix 1 scoop of SEEQ Strawberry Lemonade with 16 oz. cold water. Froth or shake until fully dissolved and juicy.
3. Fill a tall glass with ice and lemon slices.
4. Pour the SEEQ mix over the ice.
5. Slowly layer the matcha on top.
6. Top with fresh lemon if you‚Äôre feeling fancy.

entry.title: Rocket Pop Refresher
entry.content:
Fuel your 4th with a firecracker of flavor the Rocket Pop Refresher is here to cool you down and level you up! Packed with juicy blue razz protein, a splash of sweet grenadine, and (if you're feelin' fancy) topped with a red, white & blue popsicle‚Äîthis drink is pure party in a glass.

Whether you're hitting the gym or the BBQ, this icy, protein-packed refresher is your new holiday go-to. Because who says your gains can't be festive?

Ingredients:
  • SEEQ Blue Razz Freeze
  • Grenadine
  • Ice
  • Optional: red, white, & blue popsicle
Directions:
  1. Mix 1 scoop of Blue Razz Freeze in 14-16 oz of water
  2. Shake with a blender bottle or use a frother to mix
  3. Add grenadine to the bottom of a separate glass
  4. Add desired amount of ice
  5. Pour Blue Razz Free over ice
  6. Optional: top with a red, white, & blue popsicle
Enjoy your juicy 4th of July drink!

entry.title: Clear Protein Blue Razz Blast
entry.content:
Blue Razz Blast Recipe

A light, juicy, and protein-infused drink perfect for your new years resolutions!

Ingredients:

  • 1 scoop SEEQ Blue Razz Freeze Clear Protein
  • 16 oz cold water
  • 1/2 cup crushed ice
  • 1/4 cup fresh or frozen raspberries or blueberries
  • 1/2 lemon, juiced
  • 1-2 tsp honey or a low-calorie sweetener (optional)
  • 1/8 tsp sparkling water or club soda (optional for a fizzy twist)

Instructions:

  1. Mix the protein: In a shaker bottle, combine SEEQ Blue Razz Freeze Clear Protein with 16 oz of cold water. Shake vigorously until fully dissolved or use a frother.
  2. Blend: Pour the protein mix into a blender. Add ice, raspberries, lemon juice, and sweetener. Blend until smooth. (if you like it less sweet remove the sweetener)
  3. Fizzy Finish (Optional): For a sparkling twist, pour the blended drink into a glass and top with sparkling water or club soda. Gently stir to combine.
  4. Garnish & Serve: Serve in a tall glass, garnished with a lemon slice and a few raspberries for extra flair!

Nutritional Info (Approx.):

  • Calories: 100-120¬†
  • Protein: 22g
  • Carbs: 3-5g
  • Fat: 0-1g

entry.title: Clear Protein Strawberry Lemonade Refresher
entry.content:
Craving a tangy and fruity protein drink? This Clear Protein Strawberry Lemonade Drink¬†is the perfect balance of sweet and tart, ideal for post-workout recovery!

Ingredients:

  • 1 scoop SEEQ Strawberry Lemonade Protein Powder
  • 2¬†cups cold water (adjust for desired sweetness and consistency)
  • 2-3 fresh strawberries (hulled and sliced)
  • Juice of 1/2 lemon (freshly squeezed)
  • 1 tsp honey or sweetener of choice (optional, for added sweetness)
  • 1 cup ice cubes
  • Optional garnish: fresh strawberries, lemon slices, or mint leaves

Instructions:

  1. Combine the base: Add cold water and SEEQ Strawberry Lemonade Protein Powder to a blender.
  2. Add the fruit: Toss in the fresh strawberries and freshly squeezed lemon juice.
  3. Sweeten it up (optional): If desired, add a teaspoon of honey or your preferred sweetener for extra flavor.
  4. Blend: Add ice cubes and blend on high until smooth and frothy.
  5. Serve and enjoy: Pour into a glass, garnish with a slice of lemon or fresh strawberries, and savor your refreshing drink!

Why You‚Äôll Love It:

  • Refreshing: Combining real strawberries and zesty lemons with SEEQ‚Äôs juicy clear protein powder for an unbeatable taste.
  • Hydrating and light: Perfect for staying cool without feeling heavy.
  • Protein-packed: Fuels your body with SEEQ‚Äôs high-quality protein to support muscle recovery and daily energy.

entry.title: Spooky Caramel Apple Protein Mocktail
entry.content:
Sink your fangs into this eerie Halloween protein drink‚Äîthe Spooky Caramel Apple Mocktail‚Äîcrafted with the magic SEEQ Sour Green Apple Clear Whey Protein. Frightfully sweet, tart, and packed with 22 grams of juicy protein, it‚Äôs the perfect potion for any spooky celebration. Want to make it extra wicked? Add a splash of your favorite vodka or caramel vodka for a hauntingly good twist!

INGREDIENTS:

  • 1 scoop of SEEQ Sour Green Apple Clear Whey Protein
  • 10-12 oz of water
  • 1 spoonful of powdered sugar
  • 1-2 drops of natural red food dye
  • Garnish with spooky eyeball gummies

INSTRUCTIONS:

  1. For the rim, mix powdered sugar, natural red food dye, and 1/2 tablespoon of water until you get a blood-red effect
  2. Chill your glass in the fridge for a few minutes to let the rim set
  3. Use a frother or shaker, and combine 10-12 oz of water and 1 scoop of SEEQ Sour Green Apple Clear Whey Protein. Mix thoroughly
  4. Pour the protein mixture into your rimmed glass, filled with ice
  5. Add a splash of caramel syrup and top off with sparkling water
  6. Garnish with spooky eyeball gummies for an extra eerie effect. Cheers!

TIPS & TRICKS:

  • Want to make this Halloween protein drink a cocktail? Add 1 1/2 oz of caramel vodka

entry.title: Clear Protein Punch
entry.content:
Clear Protein Punch¬†

Ingredients:

  • 1 scoop of fruit punch-flavored clear protein
  • 1 cup of cold coconut water (for extra hydration and electrolytes)
  • ¬Ω cup of fresh pineapple juice (for a sweet, tropical flavor)
  • ¬º cup of orange juice (for a citrusy kick)
  • ¬º cup of pomegranate juice (for a burst of antioxidants and tangy flavor)
  • 1 tablespoon of fresh lime juice (for a zesty refreshment)
  • Add water to adjust sweetness
  • Ice cubes
  • Fresh mint leaves for garnish (optional)
  • Pineapple or orange slices for garnish (optional)

Instructions:

  1. In a shaker or blender bottle, combine the fruit punch clear protein, coconut water, pineapple juice, orange juice, pomegranate juice, and fresh lime juice.
  2. Shake or stir vigorously until the protein powder is fully dissolved and the drink is well-mixed.
  3. Fill a glass with ice cubes and pour the fruit punch drink over the ice.
  4. Garnish with fresh mint leaves and pineapple or orange slices for a bright and tropical presentation.
  5. Serve immediately and enjoy!

This fruit punch drink is not only refreshing but also packed with 22 grams of clear protein, making it a perfect hydrating and flavorful protein boost. The combination of coconut water, pineapple, and citrus juices creates a light and invigorating taste that feels perfect for hot days or after your workout!

entry.title: Juicy Peach Ring Mocktail
entry.content:
Meet your new summer obsession: the Juicy Peach Ring Mocktail. Where every sip reveals the sweet, sun-soaked essence of ripe peaches, whisking you away to a sun-dappled orchard. Blended with SEEQ's Juicy Peach Clear Whey Protein, this refreshingly delicious treat is your ticket to a sunny escape, no matter the season. Feeling a bit adventurous? Turn it into a cocktail by adding a splash of your favorite vodka. And don‚Äôt miss the tips and tricks at the bottom of the page to elevate your peachy experience!

INGREDIENTS:

  • 1 scoop of SEEQ Juicy Peach Clear Whey Protein Isolate
  • 4-6 oz of water
  • 2 oz of fresh peach pur√©e (about half of a large peach)
  • 1/2 oz of lemon juice
  • 1/2 oz of sugar free grenadine¬†
  • Garnish with a peach slice and a gummy peach ring

INSTRUCTIONS:

  1. In a shaker, combine 4-6 oz of water and 1 scoop of SEEQ Juicy Peach Clear Whey Protein. Shake thoroughly.
  2. In a blender or food processor, blend the peach until smooth to create a pur√©e.
  3. Strain the peach pur√©e through a fine mesh sieve directly into a glass.
  4. Add 1/2 oz of lemon juice and the SEEQ Juicy Peach Clear Whey Protein mix to the glass, then stir in some ice.
  5. Pour in the grenadine, letting it settle to the bottom.
  6. Garnish with a peach slice and a gummy peach ring. Cheers!

TIPS & TRICKS:

  • Instead of straining peach pur√©e through a fine mesh sieve into a glass, you can peel the peach before blending
  • Transform this mocktail into a cocktail by combining peach pur√©e, lemon juice, 1 1/2 oz of vodka, and 1/2 oz of peach schnapps in a cocktail shaker. Shake well, then strain into a glass with the SEEQ Juicy Peach Clear Whey Protein mix. Add ice and savor the moment!

entry.title: Strawberry Lemonade Popsicles
entry.content:
Beat the heat with your new go-to cool-down snack.

Ingredients:
‚Äì 1 scoop SEEQ Strawberry Lemonade Clear Protein
‚Äì 16 oz. cold water
‚Äì A handful of fresh-cut strawberries
‚Äì Optional: 2 tbsp sugar (if you‚Äôre feelin‚Äô sweet)

Instructions:
1. Add fresh strawberry slices into your popsicle molds
2. Mix 1 scoop of SEEQ Strawberry Lemonade with 16 oz. water (froth or shake
3. Pour the mixture over the strawberries
4. Add popsicle sticks and freeze
5. Pop them out & enjoy!

¬†

entry.title: Find Your Greatness - SEEQ
entry.content:
We were sick of the boring traditional thick and milky protein options on the market, so we started working with food scientists and formulators to create a protein that has a juice-like consistency, and SEEQ was born. Our customers are dominantly in the fitness space; however, we are positioning ourselves in the market as an approachable brand to all active people and are not just singling out the heavy gym-goers.

¬†

Tell us about yourself

I've been an entrepreneur at heart since I was in high school. From flipping items on Facebook and eBay to going door-to-door selling exterior painting services, I've always had the passion to be my own boss and to make things happen. Previously to SEEQ, I owned a small marketing agency where I was focused on driving the digital marketing goals of small businesses in MN. I met Ben Zaver, the Founder of SEEQ when he interned at a marketing agency that I was already working at.

After his internship ended, I didn't really hear from him until one day; he stopped by our office in Minneapolis. He gave us all samples of this juice-like protein. I was super jacked to see someone go after their dream and start their entrepreneurial journey. I already have a passion for being an entrepreneur; I extended my help, and he gladly took it. He worked on it two years before we launched; I jumped on board about six months into his journey. We officially launched in October 2021, and we've seen explosive growth on social media. We are both full-time on this journey, and the thing that motivates us each day to continue what we are doing is seeing the community that we are slowly building. It's one thing just to sell a product, but it's another thing to build a brand and a culture that people want to be a part of.

What's your biggest accomplishment as a business owner?

I'd have to say the thing that has excited us the most would have to be selling out our new flavor in just 6 hours. Seeing over 1000 people on the site at one time and having thousands of orders come in just the first 15 minutes was hard for us to wrap our heads around. We're so grateful for our community and everyone that has supported us so far.

What's one of the hardest things that come with being a business owner?

Burnout is real, and many entrepreneurs and marketers can relate to that. Nobody tells you about manufacturing agreements or how to negotiate and all the other little things that come with owning a business. Although that is difficult, it's also really exciting to us that we now have more experience under our belt for the next thing that we start.

What are the top tips you'd give to anyone looking to start, run and grow a business today?

  1. Don't wait till you're ready or for it to be perfect; otherwise, you'll always be waiting. Start now with what you have, knowing that things will change.
  2. Connect with people that you want to learn from and look up too often, at least one new conversation each week. There's a reason why people always say your network is your net worth.
  3. Focus more on brand and community, overselling your product. When you focus on the people buying your product instead of just trying to sell your product, you seem more authentic, and people will gravitate towards that.

entry.title: Maple Grove grad seeing growth with unique protein shake business
entry.content:
hen Maple Grove alumnus Ben Zaver graduated from college during the pandemic shutdown, he didn‚Äôt know it would give him plenty of time to pursue a business dream opportunity.

Born and raised in Plymouth, he attended elementary and middle school in Maple Grove and then went on to graduate from Maple Grove Senior High School.

In May 2020, Zaver graduated from Minnesota State University, Mankato, with a degree in mechanical engineering. ‚ÄúI was at a job interview in Arizona during spring break when COVID hit and I finished college online back home in Plymouth,‚Äù he said.

The pandemic forced him to stay at home, but this allowed Zaver to start his own protein company. His company, SEEQ, started with a basic idea.

‚ÄúI always hated the taste and texture of the typical thick and milky protein shakes and thought there had to be a better option,‚Äù he said.

Zaver did some research and found a manufacturer that invented an ingredient that was able to make the consistency of protein shakes more like a juice. ‚ÄúThis allowed us to make refreshing fruity flavors like strawberry and mango pineapple possible,‚Äù he said. ‚Äú[The] fruity flavors are a lot more refreshing after a workout and don‚Äôt leave you feeling bloated. We like to think we make protein shakes that people actually look forward to drinking.‚Äù

During the pandemic quarantine, Zaver said he had a lot of time on his hands and spent a lot of it doing research and networking as well as learning some programming, website development, packaging and all kinds of other things that go into starting a product.

‚ÄúAfter we found the right [manufacturer], I subjected my friends and family to hundreds of taste tests until we got the flavors and consistency just right,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúThere was a lot of trial and error. That just led me to do a lot more of that type of things on my own.‚Äù

His parents Steve and Kate said COVID changed everyone‚Äôs plans. ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs what I call a silver lining,‚Äù Kate Zaver said. ‚ÄúSo many nights of family walks, movie nights and home projects were great, but I knew Ben would get bored after graduating from college. He had been thinking of this protein idea and once he shared his vision, it was on.‚Äù

They said it was hard to watch him struggle during setbacks, but Zaver‚Äôs optimism and kept him forging ahead.

entry.title: SEEQ protein powder company, co-founded by Sioux Falls woman, gains popularity through TikTok
entry.content:
Hannah Perez always had an interest in entrepreneurship. She grew up in Sioux Falls and graduated from Roosevelt High School in 2016, which is when her passion for creating a business really began.

In high school, Perez enjoyed reselling knock-off Yeezy boots, which were very popular at the time, and that eventually led her to¬†becoming the co-founder of SEEQ, a clear protein powder company that does its market exclusively on TikTok.

Perez initially went to college in Mankato, Minnesota, for elementary education, but she soon switched her major to marketing when she realized her true desire was to go into business.

¬†

One of her internships, called College Works Painting, involved starting a company, building a team and going door to door selling paint.¬†

‚ÄúThat really created my drive and let me know that I am capable of doing something that‚Äôs hard and just-out-of-left-field, like selling paint,‚Äù said Perez. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm not passionate about paint, but if I can sell that, I‚Äôll be able to do anything.‚Äù

After graduating, Perez started working at a digital marketing startup called The Social Butterfly in Minneapolis, where she met Ben Zaver, who came on as an intern.¬†

Eventually, The Social Butterfly shut down and Perez started her own digital marketing agency, Awake Social, but not before Zaver came and pitched his new protein powder, hoping to start it as a business. Perez jumped on the idea, and the two spent the next year developing the company before launching SEEQ in October 2021.¬†

‚ÄúI know how to manage a business. I am really big into fitness, so this was right up my alley,‚Äù said Perez. Zaver‚Äôs parents loaned them initial investment money for that first round of inventory and things took off after that.

‚ÄúWithout them, we wouldn‚Äôt be here, so shout-out to the Zaver family,‚Äù said Perez.¬†

entry.title: How this protein-powder startup is using TikTok to sell out inventory faster than it can restock
entry.content:
Ben Zaver¬†was a few months away from graduating with a mechanical engineering degree when the pandemic started.

Rather than begin his engineering career, Zaver used the time spent sheltering at home to develop a whey protein powder that was clear and refreshing, unlike the chunky and unpleasant-tasting powders that dominate the market.¬†

After taking a year-and-a-half to perfect the formula, and teach himself how to run a business, Zaver along with Co-founder¬†Hannah Perez¬†launched Seeq in October 2021. In the ensuing months, the pair have posted $800,000 in sales solely by marketing on TikTok.

Zaver's account on the social platform rarely emphasizes the benefits of the product, but focuses instead on storytelling.¬†

The brand‚Äôs momentum on TikTok began two days before the product even launched when a video of Zaver and Perez giving samples around Minneapolis went viral. That initial interest led to the first batch of inventory selling out in a month.¬†¬†

‚ÄúWe honestly had no clue how fast it would sell,‚Äù Zaver said. ‚ÄúI was honestly thinking anywhere between like five and six months.‚Äù¬†

When it came time to replenish that initial 14-pallet shipment, which was delivered to Zaver‚Äôs parents‚Äô house, the pair learned they were facing a four-month lead time. Instead of immediately opening shop again for pre-orders, Perez said they took those four months to learn and make adjustments.¬†

One of those adjustments was the decision to move operations out of his parents‚Äô basement and into a warehouse in Plymouth. Since making the move, they‚Äôve already sold out of a 38-pallet shipment and are now expecting 150 more pallets in the next month.¬†

Zaver said Seeq‚Äôs followers think it's selling out so quickly to demonstrate scarcity and build more buzz around the product, but he promises supply-chain delays are to blame.
‚ÄúWe could not be ordering more,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre ordering like hundreds of thousands of pounds. But I think in the next four or five months we will finally be caught up.‚Äù¬†

The powder is produced by a turnkey manufacturer in Wisconsin that does everything from sourcing ingredients to packaging the 1.5-pound bottles.¬†

Looking ahead, Zaver and Perez said it would be easy to not change anything about their business model, but they plan to start selling on Amazon at the end of the year.
